title: API exposes full User objects with sensitive data
description: MAJOR BUG: When the API sends user information attached to other API calls (project owner, task assignee, etc.), it sends the entire User object including personal settings, roles, and other sensitive data. Should only send minimal public user info (id, name, avatar).

title: Creating account via OIDC SSO didn't spin up a guild
Make email login case-insensitive
description:
Email addresses should be treated as case-insensitive for login and all lookups. Currently if a user registers with 'User@Example.com' and tries to login with 'user@example.com', it fails.

Affected areas:
- Login (auth.py:156)
- Registration email check (auth.py:61)  
- OIDC callback (auth.py:317)
- Password reset (auth.py:409)
- Create user admin endpoint (users.py:107)

Solution:
- Normalize emails to lowercase when storing them in the database
- Use case-insensitive comparison (func.lower()) for all email lookups
- Normalize email input on frontend before submission
close_reason: Implemented case-insensitive email authentication and added autoCapitalize=none. Commit: 1b74574

title: Fix InitiativesPage crash when query data is not an array
description:
User reported crash with error: (f.data ?? []).forEach is not a function

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a task in the default project
2. Create a new project
3. Edit the task to move it to the second project
4. Try to navigate to the second project

Root cause: InitiativesPage.tsx lines 99 and 107 use null coalescing (?? []) which doesn't protect against truthy non-array values. If the query data is an object or other truthy non-array value, .forEach() will fail.

Fix: Add Array.isArray() checks to ensure we only call .forEach() on actual arrays.
close_reason: Fixed by adding Array.isArray() checks in 4 files. Commit: 49b6c70
